functions.name: booleanArgument
functions.description: A handy computed property that is casting empty arguments to true

returns.description: computed property that returns true or false depending on the passed argumentName

functions.name: objStr
functions.description:
A simple function that turns object keys into a single string, if the value is truthy or an empty string

let classNames = objStr({
  'btn-primary': true,
  'btn-small': false,
  'btn-circle: checkCircle() // true
});

// 'btn-primary btn-circle'

functions.name: testRootElementId
functions.description:
Returns the testing container ID if the current environment is "test"

An alert component used to display some feedback message

  <d.Trigger>
    Open
  </d.Trigger>

  <d.Content>

    </d.button>
  </d.Content>
</Dropdown>

component:hex/components/modal~ModalComp.title: ModalComponent
component:hex/components/modal~ModalComp.text: A component that displays content in a layer blocking the interaction with the page. <Modal @size="sm" @onClose={{action this.closeModal}} as |m|> <m.Header> Create Record </m.Header> <m.Body> Awesome </m.Body> <m.Footer> <Button @primary type="submit">Save</Button> </m.Footer> </Modal>

attributes.name: ModalComponent
attributes.description:
A component that displays content in a layer blocking the interaction with the page.

<Modal @size="sm" @onClose={{action this.closeModal}} as |m|>
  <m.Header>
    Create Record
  </m.Header>

  <m.Body>
    Awesome
  </m.Body>

  <m.Footer>
    <Button @primary type="submit">Save</Button>
  </m.Footer>
</Modal>

template:docs/components/alert.title: Alert
template:docs/components/alert.text: Alert An Ember component for providing contextual feedback messages for typical user actions. Variants The component comes with couple of different variations. You can use them as boolean attributes by passing @success={{true}} or @success={{false}}, or by just setting the variant flag like @success for example. A great challenge of life: Knowing enough to think you're doing it right, but not enough to know you're doing it wrong. I get a clock radio. He cannot afford. Great success! Any time scientists disagree, it's because we have insufficient data. Then we can agree on what kind of data to get; we get the data; and the data solves the problem. Either I'm right, or you're right, or we're both wrong. And we move on. That kind of conflict resolution does not exist in politics or religion. Dynamic variant You can use the @variant property to define the style dynamically. Info Success Danger A great challenge of life: Knowing enough to think you're doing it right, but not enough to know you're doing it wrong.

template:docs/components/badge.title: Badge
template:docs/components/badge.text: Badge A styled badge component Variants The component comes with couple of different variations. You can use them as boolean attributes by passing @primary={{true}} or @primary={{false}}, or just by setting the variant flag like @primary for example. Default Primary Success Danger Warning Info Light Dark As links If you want to display a link as a badge, you need to manually add the class names. Default Primary Success Danger Warning Info Light Dark

template:docs/components/blanket.title: Blanket
template:docs/components/blanket.text: Blanket A component that covers the underlying UI for a layered component. HideShow Blanket

template:docs/components/button.title: Button
template:docs/components/button.text: Button An Ember component that is a base button. Variants The component comes with couple of different variations. You can use them as boolean attributes by passing @primary={{true}} or @primary={{false}}, or by just setting the variant flag like @primary for example. Default Primary Danger Warning Subtle Link Small Variant You can reduce the size of the <Button /> component by passing @small attribute. Default Primary Danger Warning Subtle Link Large Variant You can increase the size of the <Button /> component by passing @large attribute. Default Primary Danger Warning Subtle Link Icons The button components should work well with SVG icons. The default behavior is for the icon to be before the text, but if you need to add it after it, you can set -right modifier class to it. Edit Close Trash Close Close Close

template:docs/components/card.title: Card
template:docs/components/card.text: Card A component for displaying content in a separate section. Technolojesus Even with all our technology and the inventions that make modern life so much easier than it once was, it takes just one big natural disaster to wipe all that away and remind us that, here on Earth, we're still at the mercy of nature. Accept Cancel

template:docs/components/dropdown.title: Dropdown
template:docs/components/dropdown.text: Dropdown A dropdown component, based on ember-basic-dropdown Toggle One Three Two

template:docs/components/input-field.title: Input Field
template:docs/components/input-field.text: Input Field Input field component One of the ways to use the component, is to provide @value property. Doing that the property will get updated in the input event. If you want to manually handle this, you can provide @onChange handler which will return the value of the input. This is more or less equal to oninput={{action (mut this.value) value="target.value"}}. Debug: Current value:

template:docs/components/modal.title: Modal
template:docs/components/modal.text: Modal A component that displays content in a layer blocking the interaction with the page. Show Modal Show Small Modal Show Large Modal Last Day of Magic Our galaxy, the Milky Way, is one of 50 or 100 billion other galaxies in the universe. And with every step, every window that modern astrophysics has opened to our mind, the person who wants to feel like they're the center of everything ends up shrinking. Some asteroids have us in their sights. Be nice to sort of go near them and find out what they're made of, possibly tag their ears so they're always broadcasting to us their location. In case one of their trajectories head straight for us, we'll know well in advance to do something about it. Pluto's orbit is so elongated that it crosses the orbit of another planet. Now that's... you've got no business doing that if you want to call yourself a planet. Come on, now! There's something especially transgressive about that. Save Cancel

template:docs/components/search-field.title: SearchField
template:docs/components/search-field.text: SearchField Styled search field component. The passed @value is mutated, unless @onChange action is provided. In that case, the action will be called with the new value. Debug: Current value:

template:docs/components/select-field.title: SelectField
template:docs/components/select-field.text: SelectField SelectField component One of the ways to use the component, is to provide @selected property. Doing that the property will get updated in the change event. If you want to manually handle this, you can provide @onChange handler which will return the value of the select. This is more or less equal to onchange={{action (mut this.selected) value="target.value"}}. Debug: Current value:

Then we can agree on what kind of data to get; we get the data; and the data solves the problem. Either I'm right, or you're right, or we're both wrong. And we move on.
